results.title: The Dilemma: a child sexual abuse training package for doctors
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cochrane, John R. Hipwell, Community Services Victoria, Film Victoria and HIPS Film and Video Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to assist general practitioners to appropriately identify and manage their response to child abuse and neglect focussing on one general practitioners response to a case of child sexual abuse. Accompanied by a 27p. User’s Guide.

results.title: The Eagle has landed [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, David Niven Jr, Jack Wiener and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Colonel with the Luftwaffe, imprisoned for striking a fellow officer, is offered a lifeline when Nazi Colonel Radl (Robert Duvall) asks him to lead a daring suicide mission to kidnap Winston Churchill. Radl has received direct orders from Heinrich Himmler (Donald Pleasance), who in turn, has been instructed by Hitler himself. The PM is known to be holidaying in Norfolk, so recently released prisoner Karl Steiner (Michael Caine) and his men parachute into Sudley Constable, a small village nearby, camouflaged as Polish allies. The sixteen man team comprises of a motley crew of stereotypes, including a honey voiced IRA man Liam Devlin (Donald Sutherland), who dupes a young girl on horseback (Jenny Agutter) - one of the few women in the film. After an incident in which one of his men saves the life of a local boy, their mission is jeopardised when the rescuer is killed and his Nazi identity revealed beneath the Polish garb. Steiner and his men take refuge in a Church as they await the arrival of Churchill to complete the Fuhrer’s orders. Based on the Jack Higgins novel, this was the last film John Sturges (The Great escape, The Magnificent seven) directed before his death in 1992. Cast also includes Anthony Quayle, Jean Marsh, Treat Williams and Larry Hagman. Screenplay by Tom Mankiewicz.

results.title: The Eagle's track
results.creator_credit: S. Sprudin, W Wiesidlek and Film Polski
results.brief_description: The High Tatra Mountains have become the climbing and ski ground of Poland. This film takes us with a party which follows the arduous “Eagle’s Track” to one of the highest peaks. The film describes and captures the excitement of mountaineering and shows, incidentally, the equipment and methods used for climbing rock, ice and snow.

results.title: The Devil and Daniel mouse
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Using traditional cell animation, the timeless story of the person who sells his soul to the devil in return for present success is told. Jan and Dan are a not-too-successful folk singing duo, when Jan signs a contract with the devil to become a famous rock singer. When the devil comes to collect Jan, Dan demands a trial. Photographed by Lenora Hume; script by Ken Sobol; edited by Bob Ablack; music by John Sebastian.

results.title: The Dream (Week 2)
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley, Todd Abbott and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Games of the 27th Olympiad held in Sydney. Highlights from the television program ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. Features Roy and HG’s special comments on Greco-Roman wrestling, gymnastics, weightlifting, synchronized swimming, diving, taekwondo, boxing and equestrian dressage. Newsbreak with Bardot, Marcia Hines, Billie Jean King, Yvonne Kenny, Sam Riley as well as special guest appearances by Matt Welsh, Hayley Lewis, Gary Hall Jnr, Natalie Cook, Kerrie Pottharst, Todd Woodbridge, Mark Woodford and Tatiana Grigorieva.

results.title: The Dream (Week 1)
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley, Todd Abbott and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Olympic Games. Highlights from the television progam ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the Sydney Olympic Games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. This tape shows highlights of week one including Eric Moussambini’s historic solo 100 metre swim, the Russian Gymnastics, diving, rowing and judo finals.

results.title: The Drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Adrian de Potier, Basil Wright and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Drawings and notes of Leonardo da Vinci from the Royal Collection at Windsor Castle, the Royal Academy and the British Museum with some comment and explanation, to celebrate the quincentenary of Leonardo’s birth. Narrated by Sir Laurence Olivier.

results.title: The Drag
results.creator_credit: Carlos Marchiori, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon about a young man who becomes a chain smoker. Explains to young people the psychology of the smoking habit, including the part played by cigarette advertising.

results.title: The Double headed eagle: Hitler's rise to power 1918-1933
results.creator_credit: Lutz Becker, David Puttnam, Sandy Lieberson, Argos Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: This extraordinary documentary charts the rise to power of Hitler and the Nazis, through the chaos of the Weimar republic. Rather than using voice-over narration the film relies on newsreels, home movie footage, and extracts from musicals and documentaries of the period to describe the state of German society during turbulent times. In doing so it reveals the disintegration of the old Germany and the advancement of the new, as represented by young Adolf Hitler and his peers. The film is broken into chapters, each dedicated to a different year during this period. Written by Lutz Becker and Philippe Mora. In German with English subtitles and captions.
